Key Match Events: Brazil won 1-0 at home over Ecuador, the goal was scored by Rodrygo at minute 30'.
Yellow card for Lucas Moura of Brazil after a foul in the opponent's half on Carlos Gruezo.
Four minutes of added time will be played in the second half.
Pre-Game Insights: We are ready to bring you the broadcast of the match between Brazil and Ecuador, valid for matchday seven of the South American Qualifying Round for the 2026 World Cup.
The match between Brazil and Ecuador will take place at the Major Antônio Couto Pereira Stadium in the city of Curitiba (Brazil).
One of the players to take into account in Ecuador is Kevin Rodriguez, the 24 year old center forward is currently playing for Club Union St. Gilloise of Belgium.
One of the most outstanding players in Brazil is Rodrygo, the 23-year-old center forward is currently playing for Club Real Madrid of Spain.
In total, both squads have met five times since 2016, Brazil dominates the record with four wins, no draws have been recorded and Ecuador has won one match.
Ecuador has been performing well in the current edition of the South American Qualifiers for the 2026 World Cup.
Brazil has been performing well in the South American Qualifiers for the 2026 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: We end the coverage of Brazil's 1-0 victory over Ecuador on matchday 7 of the South American Qualifiers for the 2026 World Cup.
